headline: Jamie Dimon says he's not retiring from JPMorgan Chase for 'several years'
summary: Don’t expect JPMorgan Chase (JPM) CEO Jamie Dimon to step down anytime soon. That’s still “several years away,” he said on Monday.

headline: JPMorgan's Jamie Dimon Says His Retirement Is 'Years Away'
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. CEO Jamie Dimon says his retirement is "several years away," but the decision is up to the bank's board. He spoke to Fox Business. Bloomberg's Sonali Basak and Matt Miller talk about Dimon's retirement timeline and what his exit could mean for the bank.

raw.headline: JPMorgan's Jamie Dimon Says His Retirement Is 'Years Away'
raw.summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. CEO Jamie Dimon says his retirement is "several years away," but the decision is up to the bank's board. He spoke to Fox Business. Bloomberg's Sonali Basak and Matt Miller talk about Dimon's retirement timeline and what his exit could mean for the bank.

headline: Jamie Dimon Says He Isn’t Retiring Anytime Soon
summary: “Obviously, it’s always up to God and the board,” Dimon said in a taped interview on Fox Business Network’s “Mornings with Maria” that aired Monday.  Dimon has been CEO of JPMorgan for nearly two decades and surprised investors last year when he said he would step down within five years.  JPMorgan’s next chief executive will have ample advice to draw from; Dimon has dispensed plenty of tips over the years on what makes for good leadership.

headline: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon tells Fox Business US debt could cause bond turmoil
summary: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon said on Monday that the rising U.S. national debt is going to create a "tough time" for the bond market and could eventually cause spreads to widen, he told Fox Business' "Mornings with Maria" program.
